item.title: Teaching History: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: History teaching today is leaning more towards being a ‘science’ than an ‘art’. Here are some of the key ideas you will come across often in teacher education. Definitions of History Teaching

item.title: Propaganda: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: Propaganda types and methods are important not just for history students to know, but also for everyday citizens. Through familiarity with the propaganda practices on this page, a person can be better equipped to fight against the constant attempts to manipulate them into buying a product or voting for a candidate. Definitions of Propaganda

item.title: Modern Ideologies: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:

item.title: World Religions: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description: I always started teaching tenth grade world history with a review of religions and government systems around the world. Here is a page to help with that. Definitions of World Religions

item.title: Economic Systems: Definitions of Key Terms
item.description:
Thank you to all the people who have visited the site this week! I would love to hear what you think, so please email if you can.

Today’s addition to the site: if you are not well-schooled in economic terminology, I’ve put together a quick cheat sheet for you to reference. This is definitely one of the longer lists of definitions I plan to put up. It is not in any particular order yet, so please browse the list to find the particular term you are looking for.

Definitions of Economic Systems

item.title: Comparative Studies of the Atlantic Revolutions
item.description:
I have now finished the first round of bibliographies for this site - there are more than 50 lists of books to start researching various world history and genocide topics here!

The Atlantic revolutions book list I’ve put together focuses on comparing events in the Americas, including Haiti and the United States.

Bibliography of Comparative Atlantic Revolutions
